result.execSummary:
The defendant Ontarius M McFerren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; First 6 months STRAIGHT TIME, remainder of the sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision, pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE COURT WILL ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  First 6 months straight time, remainder of the sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Case was scheduled for sentencing hearing on 09/30/2015, however Branch 22 will not be in session.  Parties contacted, new sentencing date is 09/28/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Justice Point report addressed- Defendant was reminded that cooperation with Justice Point is a condition of bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.  aw

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw

Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building. Substitution filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Witkowiak.  Court contacted Judge Watts court for the next court date. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz. Ron Dague for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ontarius M McFerren in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
